an4.179:1.1: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to Venerable Sāriputta, and exchanged greetings with him.
an4.179:1.2: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, Ānanda sat down to one side, and said to Sāriputta:
an4.179:1.3: “What is the cause, Reverend Sāriputta, what is the reason why some sentient beings aren’t fully extinguished in the present life?”
an4.179:2.1: “Reverend Ānanda, it’s because some sentient beings don’t really understand which perceptions make things worse, which keep things steady, which lead to distinction, and which lead to penetration.
an4.179:2.2: That’s the cause, that’s the reason why some sentient beings aren’t fully extinguished in the present life.”
an4.179:3.1: “What is the cause, Reverend Sāriputta, what is the reason why some sentient beings are fully extinguished in the present life?”
an4.179:3.2: “Reverend Ānanda, it’s because some sentient beings truly understand which perceptions make things worse, which keep things steady, which lead to distinction, and which lead to penetration.
an4.179:3.3: That’s the cause, that’s the reason why some sentient beings are fully extinguished in the present life.”
